intro: Heterotheca ruthii, commonly known as the blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Heterotheca ruthii is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
